runs.comm: full on the pads, played wide of mid-on
gets some shape from outside off, left alone
squared up by a ripper of an outswinger. He played back to full ball, didn't miss the edge by much
gets a thick edge that flies down to third man
ball lobs to the keeper off the pad, there was a stifled appeal but umpire Anil Chaudhary shakes his head. He reckons it was too high, the sound was that of the bat hitting the pad
flicked Sanath Jayasuriya style into the deep square boundary. Too full, he was looking for the late swing, but there was none and he picked that away superbly
into the blockhole, he jams his bat down in time to get an inside edge, somehow keeps it away
width on offer and he's crunched that between the two point fielders. Standing tall and watching it onto the bat, it pinged the middle and flew away
worked with the angle towards deep square

so the comeback hasn't been a sweet one for Tamim. Looked to play across the line to a delivery that was dead straight on middle, and once he missed there was little chance of him surviving the strong appeal
shot of a man in supreme form. Strays onto the pad and he wrists it delightfully into the deep midwicket region
awkward bounce that hits him high on the thigh pad as he looks to fend, they get a leg-bye though
plays outside the line of a delivery that nips back in to beat the inside edge, zips through to the keeper
bunts it to backward point, hurried into his stroke again
gets hold of the pull this time. Picks the length early and gets it up and over the infield, excellent roll of the wrists as well, one bounce into the boundary
hops back and taps it back to the bowler
checks his shot at the last moment, just eludes the point fielder
flies off the middle, straight to Umar Akmal at point
cuts and misses. There was plenty of width, so a scoring opportunity missed
mistimes a pull towards midwicket, bit of confusion between both batsmen, non-striker somehow makes it back in
walks across to help it over short fine, can only get a bit of glove on it, falls short of the fielder there
dabs it down to third man
on the pads, worked wide of midwicket
dabs it to short third man
worked away superbly off his hip. He's timing them really sweet here. Length ball on middle and leg, superb wrist work to get it behind square.
appeal for lbw, but the ball would have missed leg, rolls off the pad towards midwicket
mistimes a cut, straight to point
checks his shot, lobs in the air but just short of the cover fielder. Excellent change of pace, it was the off-cutter, Sarkar was into the stroke a little too early
pushed to mid-off
squared up as the ball flies off the thick edge to third man
too short, but he's hurried into the pull shot, gets it down towards deep backward square leg
slants across the batsman, he plays and misses, or did he get a nick? Looked like he started to walk at first and then stood his ground. If there was an edge, had to be the tiniest of nicks.
pulled, but not entirely off the middle, straight to deep midwicket
pulls, gets a faint inside edge but they scoot across for a single
beaten for pace, looked to pull but bailed out very quickly. Rip roaring bouncer on middle
opens the face of the bat and steers it down to third man
cuts, but straight to point
appeal for lbw. The ball drifts back in to beat his forward defense, deflects towards short third man. Struck outside the line
fired into the pads, swept past short fine. Poor ball, in the slot and it was duly put away.
slider this time, walks across and turns it to the leg side
slog sweeps it towards deep midwicket, one bounce to the fielder
skids onto him, pushed back to the bowler
delightful wrist work, fetches the flick from outside off towards long-on

he nearly committed hara-kiri there. Looks to loft him over the infield, can only get a toe end, but somehow manages to elude the fielder running back from mid-off. The shot wasn't necessary, on another night, he may have hit it straight to the fielder
hit hard but straight to cover
worked from middle stump to midwicket
slower and fuller on middle, crunched to sweeper cover, sensible batting this
looks to swing that over midwicket, gets a toe end of the bat, rolls towards square leg

the captain has struck against the run of play. This one was fired in, superb drift as well, Sabbir stepped out and pushed outside the line, only to see the ball sneak through and deflect off the pad onto the stumps.
slow turn away from off stump, beats the outside edge
driven through the line to long-off
this one's an off-cutter, bit of grip, defended
gets a leading edge, just wide of point, they were chancing a second run, somehow managed to make it in time, was really close
reverse sweeps that towards deep point, top work in the deep. Saved three runs
that's into the second tier. Sarkar is showing he can be a basher of the cricket ball too. Steps out and pulls it away in front of square. Pinged the middle of the bat
helps it up and over point
width on offer, bunted towards point, good stop
opens the face of the bat and eases it wide of backward point
pulled, but lands short of the man running in from deep midwicket, was cramped for room as he played the stroke
fired in full but well down leg, good take by Sarfraz
he packs a punch when he pulls. Too short at a friendly pace, he picks the length early and hammers the pull into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on. One bounce into the boundary
eases it to short third man for a quick single
wrong line and punished. Powerful sweep towards deep fine leg
driven to cover, a misfield allows a single, Hafeez the culprit there, the look of disbelief on Waqar's face says it all
slow turn away from off stump, pushed to point
short, makes a bit of room and crunches it to deep point, a wild throw gives them an extra run. Afridi is not impressed
cuts, but straight to Anwar Ali at short third man
swing and a miss. Looked to back away and go over cover
angles it down to third man
angles it wide of point for an easy single
cleverly done, deflects it down to third man
full and straight on off, tails away late, pushed wide of mid-off
pulls, but didn't get hold of it, rolls wide of midwicket
off cutter on middle, gets forward and pats it
turned wide of square leg
played back down the ground towards Sharjeel at long-on, looked like it came off the thick inside edge
on the pads, looks to flick, comes off the pad, keeper mops it up but can't prevent the single
goes for an expansive sweep, ball spins away and hits him high on the forearm ball deflect to the off side, umpire gives it a run
nearly chopped back, good over under pressure
angles a length ball across the batsman, bunted to point where Akmal misfields

magnificent yorker to bring an end to a superb innings. That will breathe some life back into the game. This was full, at a furious pace on middle, Sarkar was late to jam his bat down as the ball squeezed through to peg back the middle stump. Amir lets out a roar as his teammates rush towards him. What a bowler, this bloke!
driven firmly to cover
gets nicely behind the line of the full delivery, defended to cover
excellent bouncer, buzzes past Shakib's ear, but umpire thinks it was just a touch over the head
bunts it wide of point
worked from outside off towards deep midwicket
sliding into middle and leg, tucked towards the vacant midwicket region

brain freeze, can't say much else. Mushfiqur looks to play a reverse sweep to a delivery that pitched outside leg, he missed it completely, Malik almost pleaded thrice before Anil Chaudhary raised the finger after deliberating long and hard. Is that another escape route for Pakistan? Change of bowling has done the trick again
worked with the spin to short fine leg, excellent running by Shakib, who had to hare to the striker's end
driven with the spin to long-off
played back to the bowler
looks to dab it down towards short third man, the ball jumped and spunn back in
looks to cut that late, misses as it nips away from off
makes room and punches it to deep cover
tapped with soft hands to the off side for a quick single
angled down towards third man, sweet timing
length ball outside off, angles it down to third man
big appeal for leg before, but there was a clear inside edge onto the pad
gets a bit of lift off the deck, angled awkwardly down to third man

top shot! Back of length delivery angling away, he makes a bit of room and hits it through the line, gets a punch on that stroke as it sails over the ropes. Backfoot off drive over mid-off, delightful
dabs it with soft hands to the off side
slapped to deep point, a couple of metres on either side and it would have been four

tried to scoop that over short fine, didn't get bat anywhere near the ball, but they scamper through for a single, Irfan ran across the turf to flick an underarm throw, but missed. Cry of anguish from Shakib, slaps the bat with his hand in disappointment
excellent delivery, floats it just a touch ahead of good length outside off, nips away late, he pokes at that one and misses
what a yorker that! Angles it into leg from wide of the crease, Shakib somehow manages to get his bat down in time to keep that away

another poor stroke, and Amir's unstoppable! This one was a length ball slanting in, Shakib gets across and looks to scoop it fine, but is clearly beaten for pace as the ball smashes into the middle and leg stump. Shakib smashes the stumps with his bat in disgust, disappointment or whatever you may call it, but quickly puts his hand up to apologise to the umpire, as if to suggest it was all too momentary. The crowd is stunned into silence. Amir's transformed a cruise into a road block here. Game on!
drilled down the ground past the diving mid-off fielder, poor effort. He slid across the turf and let the ball through. Mohammad Sami the culprit

rip roaring bouncer on the body as Mashrafe looked to back away, the ball lobs off his gloves as he tries to take evasive action, the pace is enough for the ball to deflect off the glove and fly into the fine leg boundary. The roar is back
floats it full and wide outside off, Mash looks to back away and carve it over point, missed it, just inside the wide line
this one's full and tails away from outside off to beat Mashrafe's wild swing, top over
into the blockhole, squeezed to long-on
wild swing, looking to go on side, gets some bat on it, rolls to long-off
excellent yorker, full and dead straight on middle, squeezed wide of cover

oh, dear! He's overstepped, and Mashrafe holes out to long-off. What drama! Surely he didn't hear the call, but they scoot back for the second. What's worse is it's a free-hit . Once the catch was taken, the fielder threw the ball in the air in delight, and they stole another
yorker outside off, squeezed to the diving point fielder, excellent stop, Mashrafe is angry that he missed a boundary there
hit over the bowler's head, didn't get enough power behind the stroke, long-off gets around quickly to hurl the throw at the non-striker's end

splits the gap between point and short third man. What's worse is it's another no-ball. But take nothing away from Mahmudullah's presence of mind. It was full, he held his shape and then angled his bat nicely to pick the gap. Big no-ball
hit towards deep midwicket, 15 off that over, the mood has changed, and how at the Sher-e-Bangla
full toss on middle, helped over deep midwicket in style. What power he generates off the bottom hand! Poor ball, and he duly put that away. What pressure? He did that so easily
